metadata.region: Tropical regions of South and Southeast Asia

captions: Prevents Premature Greying - Rich in antioxidants and iron, helps maintain natural hair colour and prevents early greying.
Treats Dandruff & Scalp Infections - Its anti-fungal and anti-inflammatory properties reduce dandruff, dryness, and scalp irritation.
Improves Liver Health - Supports detoxification and promotes bile secretion, useful in conditions like jaundice and fatty liver.
Boosts Immunity - Strengthens the body’s natural defence system against infections through immunomodulatory effects.
Enhances Skin Health - Cooling and healing properties make it effective for acne, eczema, and rashes.
Supports Digestion - Stimulates digestive enzymes, reducing bloating and constipation.
Reduces Stress & Anxiety - Calms the nervous system, reduces stress, and promotes better sleep.
Treats fungal infections like athlete’s foot and dermatitis with its antifungal properties; provides relief from itching.
Clears skin complexion and eliminates free radicals, preventing premature aging and keeping skin healthy.
Rue oil is used in therapeutic facial steams at spas for skin benefits.
Acts as an insecticide; its oil or extract is used to remove lice from hair, relieving itching and preventing infestations.
Common Rue oil nourishes and repairs damaged hair, making it healthy and shiny.
Used in treating epilepsy and hysteria due to its sedative and antiepileptic properties.
Contains neurotoxin that relaxes and desensitizes nerves.
As a natural insecticide and pesticide, it drives away insects and pests, helping prevent disease; used in fumigants, vaporizers, and sticks.
Exhibits antibacterial properties, treating infections like colon infection, urinary tract infection, and food poisoning caused by Salmonella.
Rich source of vitamins and minerals, including vitamin C, calcium, and iron.
Contains antioxidants like rosmarinic acid with anti-inflammatory effects that protect against chronic diseases such as heart disease and cancer.
High vitamin A content supports healthy vision.
Exhibits antimicrobial properties that help fight harmful bacteria and viruses.
Traditionally used in herbal medicine to treat digestive issues like bloating and constipation.
Studies suggest neuroprotective properties that may help prevent or slow neurological conditions such as Alzheimer’s disease.
Eucalyptus products may help relieve coughs related to respiratory conditions like bronchitis and upper respiratory tract infections.
Inhaling eucalyptus vapor or using rubs with eucalyptus oil can loosen chest mucus and make coughing more effective.
Eucalyptus oil has antibacterial and antimicrobial properties that may help protect against MRSA infections.
Inhaling eucalyptus oil steam can ease breathing by reducing and loosening mucus, benefiting conditions such as sinusitis, bronchitis, COPD, and asthma.
Eucalyptus citriodora oil shows potential in managing blood sugar levels, though human studies are still limited.
Its anti-inflammatory properties may soothe cold sores, reduce pain, and promote faster healing when applied topically with a carrier oil.
Eucalyptus oil’s antibacterial effects may help fight germs that cause bad breath, making it useful for oral hygiene.
Guava leaf extract may provide mild relief for conditions like menstrual cramps, gingivitis, and knee pain, though evidence is limited.
Eating guava regularly may help lower blood pressure and improve cardiovascular health.
Guava leaves support digestive health with antibacterial properties and high fiber that aid digestion and relieve constipation.
They help regulate blood sugar levels, stabilizing glucose spikes after meals and supporting diabetes management.
Rich in vitamin C and antioxidants, guava leaves boost the immune system and help the body fight infections.
Their powerful antioxidants reduce the risk of cancer by protecting cells from damage and mutations.
Guava leaves lower bad cholesterol and improve good cholesterol, contributing to heart health.
The vitamin A in guava leaves supports good eyesight, sharpens vision, and prevents eye-related issues.
They act as a natural stress reliever, helping reduce anxiety and promoting mental calmness.
Guava leaves aid in weight loss by boosting metabolism and supporting efficient calorie burning.
They may relieve menstrual pain and discomfort, easing cramps naturally.
With antibacterial and antioxidant properties, guava leaves improve skin health by reducing acne, fine lines, and wrinkles, while also promoting hair growth.
Mangoes are rich in vitamins K and C, supporting strong bones, healthy blood clotting, and collagen production.
The antioxidants in mangoes, such as beta-carotene and mangiferin, help fight free radicals and may lower the risk of cancer.
Mangoes support heart health with magnesium and potassium, which regulate blood pressure and pulse, while mangiferin may reduce heart inflammation.
They promote digestive health through amylase compounds that break down starches and dietary fiber that relieves constipation.
Mangoes boost the immune system with carotenoids and antioxidants that enhance defense mechanisms.
High vitamin C content in mangoes helps produce collagen, improving skin elasticity and preventing wrinkles and sagging.
Extracts from mango leaves may reduce acne and improve skin health, though more research is needed.
Eating mangoes daily has been shown to ease constipation more effectively than fiber supplements.
Mangoes are rich in beta-carotene, lutein, and zeaxanthin, which protect the eyes, retina, and lens, supporting long-term eye health.
Mango leaves contain phenolics and flavonoids that act as antioxidants, protecting against cellular damage caused by free radicals.
Mango leaves exhibit anti-inflammatory properties that may reduce oxidative stress and inflammation linked to neurodegenerative diseases.
Animal studies suggest mango leaf extract may help lower blood sugar and improve insulin function, showing promise for diabetes management.
Mango leaf infusions promote digestive health by acting as a stomach tonic, flushing out toxins, and preventing ulcers and disorders.
